title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t0.0
text: Real-time data collection means organizations can make many more informed choices based on metrics.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t7.0
text: But when do they still need humans? Find out on today's episode.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t12.0
text: I'm Amin Kazerouni from Orange Theory Fitness, and you're listening to Me, Myself and AI.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t18.0
text: Welcome to Me, Myself and AI, a podcast on artificial intelligence and business.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t24.0
text: Each episode, we introduce you to someone innovating with AI.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t28.0
text: I'm Sam Ransbotham, professor of analytics at Boston College.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t32.0
text: I'm also the AI and business strategy guest editor at MIT Sloan Management Review.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t38.0
text: And I'm Shervin Khodobande, senior partner with BCG, and I co-lead BCG's AI practice in North America.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t45.0
text: Together, MIT, SMR and BCG have been researching and publishing on AI for six years,

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t51.0
text: interviewing hundreds of practitioners and surveying thousands of companies on what it takes to build and to deploy and scale AI capabilities

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t59.0
text: and really transform the way organizations operate.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t63.0
text: Today, Shervin and I are excited to be joined by Amin Kazerouni, chief data and analytics officer for Orange Theory Fitness.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t69.0
text: Amin, thanks for joining us. Welcome.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t71.0
text: Thank you, Sam. It's great to be here. Excited for the conversation.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t74.0
text: Currently, you lead the data and analytics function at Orange Theory Fitness.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t78.0
text: Maybe tell us a little bit about the organization.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t81.0
text: Absolutely. Orange Theory Fitness is a heart rate-based, total body group workout.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t87.0
text: It combines science, great coaching, technology, and it's designed to provide what we like to think of as a more vibrant life.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t97.0
text: The workouts develop to motivate each individual member to achieve their desired results.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t105.0
text: And, you know, if you're starting on your wellness journey or you're a seasoned fitness enthusiast,

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t111.0
text: each OTF workout creates a community of shared experience, but also uses heart rate-based training to allow you to experience the workout in a way that's most comfortable for you.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t125.0
text: And that's honestly where my role comes in.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t127.0
text: There's a tremendous amount of second-by-second telemetry data from the fitness equipment, from the heart rate monitors that allow us to create the most curated, personalized kind of boutique fitness experience in the world.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t140.0
text: That's Orange Theory.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t142.0
text: All right. What do you do with all this? You've collected all this data. You've got it, this telemetry. You've got heart rate information, I assume, since you're heart rate-based.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t149.0
text: How does the process work? Take us through the steps.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t153.0
text: Most Orange Theory members in the studio will be wearing what we call a OT Beat heart rate monitor, which is a proprietary piece of wearable technology.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t163.0
text: There's two purposes to that. One is it gives you a real-life feedback loop as to how you're performing, what intensity level you're outputting in the studio.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t174.0
text: But it also allows the coach to see the intensity level that you're outputting in the studio and help effectively provide a kind of personalized fitness training experience in a studio, in a group setting.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t186.0
text: My role is focused on kind of unlocking that telemetry data and helping personalize the experience even more.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t195.0
text: A really cool example is that we recently launched a personalized max heart rate algorithm, and members now experience a much more curated experience in the studio.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t209.0
text: And that's allowing us to use proprietary algorithms to determine what the max heart rate, which is a physiological term for the maximum output that your heart can beat at, is for an individual member.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t222.0
text: And percentages of that max heart rate tell you which heart rate zone you're training in.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t227.0
text: So anaerobic training versus aerobic training have different physiological impacts.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t232.0
text: Times spent in different intensity zones have been proven to have varying effects on longevity and health in general.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t239.0
text: And being able to personalize that per member, we're able to make this experience even more curated in the studio,

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t246.0
text: while most places that leverage max heart rate will rely on a generic age-based kind of equation.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t255.0
text: And you know that, as you can imagine, every 30-year-old or 40-year-old doesn't have the same heart.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t261.0
text: So things like that are an example of how we curate the experience for our members using this data.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t267.0
text: That is a super cool example, right? Not the average for your age and gender.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t272.0
text: And then it goes by bands of 10 anyway, right?

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t275.0
text: Yeah, exactly.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t276.0
text: Like as if all 40 to 50-year-old males are like exactly have the same ability. So that's really super cool.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t283.0
text: Yeah, yeah. It makes the experience safer. It makes you more aware of what you're doing, what your capability is.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t291.0
text: And you see that cardio-respiratory fitness climb over your time with the program.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t295.0
text: And I like what's sort of inherent in what you're saying, the rapid feedback, right?

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t302.0
text: Within a few seconds, you get feedback. But also in a broader symbolic sense, what you've been proposing is more and more experimentation in general as you build AI algorithms.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t315.0
text: So it's not just the algo, but it's also experimentation because you get feedback.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t320.0
text: The philosophy of how to build AI models which relies on feedback, you're also translating that into a real use case based on rapid feedback.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t331.0
text: There's some poetry there.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t333.0
text: I didn't think of it that way, but absolutely there's poetry there.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t336.0
text: And I think that's one of the beauties of artificial intelligence algorithms is that they're so reliant on things they've seen before and constant feedback loops to get smarter.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t344.0
text: And that's exactly what the Orange Theory experience is indexed on is as the members are getting stronger, we're getting smarter and making sure that we move with them.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t355.0
text: Tell us more a bit about your data science development philosophy and how you balance experimentation with more methodical, get the algorithm to be perfect before you launch it.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t369.0
text: Just give us a sense of the trade-offs and how you and your team think about that.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t373.0
text: I love that question. And it's almost like I'll take it even a step outside of developing algorithms.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t381.0
text: I'm a firm believer that companies have started indexing so heavily on collecting as much data as is humanly possible, as much as their compute and their storage costs and their boards and their investors will allow them to.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t396.0
text: Companies collect data.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t398.0
text: And I think that what happens is once you have the data, the expectation is let's jump to machine learning, let's jump to AI.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t404.0
text: And I would argue that those, how many debates have you been in on what's AI and what's machine learning and what are the words mean?

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t411.0
text: My philosophy is to go and find those mundane, repetitive tasks and automate them first with your data where possible.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t419.0
text: Go and find intuitive, gut-based decisions that your stakeholders and verticals are uncomfortable making based off of intuition and would love to make off of data and make that data democratized, clean and available.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t435.0
text: And after that, you start the whole machine learning journey.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t440.0
text: And I think when it comes to machine learning and AI and developing an algorithm in particular, it really depends on the context and the domain in which you're working, whether you're focusing on that precision, whether you're focusing on that recall.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t454.0
text: And it really depends on what the implications of the prediction are.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t458.0
text: But generally speaking, I always err on the side of if it's safe enough, experiment and learn rather than relying on training and validation sets to chase perfection is kind of my rule of thumb philosophy.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t473.0
text: There's something also interesting, and I know you've shifted slightly into thinking about how your organization uses data, but maybe going back to how you're using it within the studios.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t482.0
text: How do you incorporate data from outside?

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t484.0
text: You know, let's say that I've been training and working and improving within the studio, but little do you know that I've hurt my foot or I've pulled the leg muscle.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t496.0
text: How does that sort of outside information come in?

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t499.0
text: I like that question a lot, Sam, because I've got two answers there.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t503.0
text: One is the coach is the hero at Orange Theory.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t508.0
text: And the way we think about it is there's 20 to 30 people in a class, but you don't want to think of it as group fitness as much as you want to think of it as, probably at least I think of it as subsidized personal training.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t520.0
text: So you've got a pretty good personal relationship with that coach, and there's no algorithm that I'm going to build that's going to be better than you telling your coach, hey, I hurt my foot last night.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t531.0
text: What do you think I should do?

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t533.0
text: And we've got alternative low impact cardio equipment in the studio so you don't get in a treadmill and start trying to run at eight miles an hour.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t541.0
text: In fact, one of the things the coach says before every class starts is if you've got any orthopedic issues, please let me know and so on and so forth.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t549.0
text: So I think that one thing that I've learned about data over the course of my career is that data is valuable and it's really good to make decisions with.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t558.0
text: But if there's a human in the loop that can scalably provide the answer instead, it's likely going to be hard to beat that expert with an algorithm.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t569.0
text: So don't get in the way of the expert.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t572.0
text: The second part to that answer is let's say you had a bunch of caffeine or you ran a marathon the previous day or you didn't sleep very well.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t581.0
text: All those external factors affect your cardiac output when you're in the studio.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t586.0
text: So that real time feedback loop allows you and the coach to modulate yourself.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t590.0
text: One thing that we encourage is if you're not feeling it, take a green day, quote unquote.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t595.0
text: Green being the zones are broken up into colors, orange and red being the anaerobic zones, zone four and five.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t603.0
text: Green being your zone three, blue being your zone two.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t606.0
text: So we recommend don't shoot for those 12 to 20 minutes in the orange and red zone.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t611.0
text: Look at your heart rate zones, listen to that real time feedback loop and take a green day if you need to.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t616.0
text: So a bit of a cop out answer there.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t619.0
text: But we've got the coach, we've got the member and we've got a real time feedback loop.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t623.0
text: And when there's an intuitive answer like that right in front of you, I don't think you should interfere with an algorithm is kind of the thought process there.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t632.0
text: I don't think that's a cop out answer at all, because historically you had a OK, you could have a personal trainer or you could be in a group setting.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t641.0
text: I think I personally identify this because you could either teach someone one on one as a tutor or you could teach someone in a giant classroom.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t648.0
text: And I'm just excited about applications like this that are letting us pull together the best of both of those worlds.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t656.0
text: I'm hungry for it in education, but I can see making a lot of progress on that.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t660.0
text: And I've talked with Peloton as well.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t663.0
text: They're starting to think about how you get to an individual level experience at scale.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t670.0
text: And that seems like what you're really trying to do.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t672.0
text: Absolutely. I couldn't have put it in my bed myself. I think that's that's exactly it.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t676.0
text: I like that a lot. This is like all about rapid feedback, which is a cornerstone of building expertise in any system.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t683.0
text: Right. Whether it's chess or whether it's running or whether it's machine learning, the more you combine experimentation and rapid feedback and the human in the loop and apply that across different industries, the more opportunity and values you're going to unleash for personalized everything, not just fitness or shopping for pants, but also education and everything.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t705.0
text: You're onto something here.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t707.0
text: Thanks for listening to me, myself and A.I. Our show is able to continue in large part due to listener support. Your streams and downloads make a big difference.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t716.0
text: If you have a moment, please consider leaving us an Apple podcast review or rating on Spotify and share a show with others you think might find it interesting and helpful.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t730.0
text: Absolutely. In my prior life, I was in retail. And when you think about the role of machine learning and deep learning in retail, it's that you're trying to recreate the in-person shopping experience on a website.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t747.0
text: Like, how do we curate this? How do we create a personal shopper? How do we create that boutique experience? How do we predict the size correctly? How do we use AR so you can see what a shoe looks like on your foot?

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t758.0
text: We're always trying to close that gap and arrive back at what the real thing would be like, personalized but at scale. And I think that's the secret sauce there, is that a rapid feedback loop, algorithmic support with large volumes of data, but then also not trying to circumnavigate around the expert, the human in the loop.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t781.0
text: Exactly. And I think that's really critical, Sam, because I remember when we did the first few years of the AI report, like back in 2018, 2019.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t791.0
text: So long ago.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t792.0
text: There was still a lot of folks. I mean, that's only three years ago, but a lot of folks still today are thinking of AI as that which replaces human and that which must automate.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t802.0
text: And the more we think that narrowly, the more outcome we're leaving on the table, the more successful workforce and humans were disenfranchising.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t812.0
text: And also, the more opportunities we're leaving unaddressed because we think, well, there's no way I can fully replace a human here, so I'm not going to do it.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t822.0
text: And there's so many of these things where it is not just AI versus human, but it's AI and human.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t829.0
text: You know, I think that there is a conflation of companies where the product is AI.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t835.0
text: Like when you think of AI, you think of Tesla and there's different industries all of them play in, but there's a very core part of the product that's a standalone piece of intellectual property that's heavily rooted in artificial intelligence.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t848.0
text: And that's not how a majority of the world is going to use artificial intelligence.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t853.0
text: And I think that's one of the kind of key differences in what you were just talking about, Shervin, is that people try and use AI the way those companies use AI and see them as the gold standard.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t864.0
text: But our product's not AI.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t866.0
text: Our product is a curated, science-backed, coach-inspired fitness experience that's just merely augmented in parts by AI.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t878.0
text: Yeah, this is something that Shervin and I are pretty excited about. I don't want to foreshadow too much, but we're thinking about these mini uses of AI beyond just this kind of poster use of AI that you're talking about.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t890.0
text: I mean, yes, we all are attracted to the Boston Dynamics robots that look very cool, but there's a lot going on that isn't that level.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t900.0
text: And there's so much value in those. And I think you're starting to capture some of that.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t905.0
text: I wanted to segue from this. We talked quite a lot about the importance of human in the loop, experimentation, being hypothesis driven, all these things you said.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t918.0
text: Maybe tell us a bit around the operating model and the ways of working in a company that is not an AI product company, but is a company like you with a strong mission.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t933.0
text: What does it take to take a use case and bring it to life?

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t939.0
text: I think it honestly comes down to three things. Is having the data. You can't really get around not having the data.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t949.0
text: Investment. I think a big mistake companies make is not investing in data engineers early thinking that you can just sprinkle AI like some kind of magic powder on raw data sets and it's going to produce something.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t963.0
text: I think data engineers are a critical commodity that you want to invest in early so your data is at a point where you can actually use it.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t971.0
text: So that investment is really important. Wherever it's coming from, there needs to be a serious decision made to invest in your data practice if you're going to really try and build one.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t982.0
text: And then finally, it's buy in. When the product's not AI, you're convincing domain experts, in our case, fitness experts that have been doing this for a long time.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t992.0
text: That are formally educated in these fields of study that are always going to know more about the product than you do.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t1000.0
text: That an algorithm is going to help them and make their job easier. And I think that that relationship can be a beautiful partnership or it can be an extremely antagonistic one.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t1011.0
text: One of the things that I've kind of strived towards in my role at Orange Theory is to have a strong partnership with our template design team, our workout design team, because at the end of the day, they are the protectors and designers of that product.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t1025.0
text: And we're, again, just a tool that's supporting them. Their buy in is very critical because their understanding of the algorithms is what then makes it to coaches in learning and development material.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t1037.0
text: At the end of the day, we've got thousands of coaches across 24 countries explaining that max heart rate algorithm that I mentioned, and they're not explaining it like a piece of mathematics.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t1049.0
text: They're explaining it like a piece of exercise fitness, like a piece of exercise physiology. And that requires that buy in. Like the AI, the data team and the fitness team need to be in lockstep. Otherwise, it's destined to fail.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t1062.0
text: And what does that mean in terms of the talent and the team, the technical team that you oversee and you hire and recruit?

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t1070.0
text: They're difficult to find is what it means. I think there's already a scarcity of talent in this space. I think in a mission driven, purpose driven company like Orange Theory, you'd think it's harder to find, but it's actually easier in the sense that if you find someone that's aligned with the mission,

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t1092.0
text: it's almost exciting to them that there's an opportunity to apply that skill set on what they consider an outside the job passion. But we've also focused on our data organization being a separate entity.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t1108.0
text: So we've got my role, the chief data analytics officer, running a data organization reporting into our CEO, and we've got our chief digital and technology officer running a separate digital and technology organization.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t1120.0
text: And what's really powerful about that is that we're able to riff off of each other and have one team provide building blocks to the other team and vice versa. And what you'd imagine creates a interesting working experience actually drives a lot of velocity and drives a really cool partnership that's very exciting to be a part of as well.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t1143.0
text: So I think it's all about that partnerships and buy ins and collaboration across teams.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t1149.0
text: Very well said. I mean, we have a special segment here where we ask you five rapid fire style questions. Just give us the first thing that comes to your mind. The key thing is like intuitive, whatever comes to your mind and short and sweet answers. So ready for that?

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t1167.0
text: Let's do it.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t1168.0
text: All right. What's your proudest AI moment?

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t1172.0
text: When we solved it using a linear regression.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t1176.0
text: Love it. All right. What worries you about AI?

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t1182.0
text: Lack of consultation with domain experts.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t1185.0
text: Well said. Your favorite activity that involves no technology?

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t1191.0
text: Hiking.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t1193.0
text: It's a question.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t1194.0
text: Yeah, it's a very simple. I was going to say orange theory, but there's too much technology in there.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t1202.0
text: The first career you wanted, like what you wanted to be when you grew up.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t1206.0
text: Environmental biologist.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t1209.0
text: Your greatest wish for AI in the future?

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t1213.0
text: More access.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t1214.0
text: Great.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t1215.0
text: Actually, I got to follow up. Access for who? Who needs access?

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t1219.0
text: I think it would be great if some of the simpler portions of AI that unlocked decisioning off of data that companies have collected was easier to tap into without the financial and human capital that you require to invest as an organization.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t1234.0
text: I think the general efficiency of the world will just go up.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t1240.0
text: More open source kind of stuff on that.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t1243.0
text: Yeah.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t1244.0
text: I mean, this has been exceedingly insightful and a lot of fun. Thank you for making time for us.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t1250.0
text: Thanks for coming.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t1251.0
text: Thanks for having me. This was a lot of fun. I truly enjoyed it.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t1255.0
text: On our next episode, we'll speak with Katera Coteverde, senior director of data science and analytics at PayPal, where she oversees data teams at Venmo and Honey. Please join us.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t1265.0
text: Thanks for listening to Me, Myself and AI.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t1268.0
text: We believe, like you, that the conversation about AI implementation doesn't start and stop with this podcast.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t1273.0
text: That's why we've created a group on LinkedIn specifically for listeners like you.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t1277.0
text: It's called AI for Leaders.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t1279.0
text: And if you join us, you can chat with show creators and hosts, ask your own questions, share your insights and gain access to valuable resources about AI implementation from MIT SMR and BCG.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t1290.0
text: You can access it by visiting MIT SMR dot com forward slash AI for Leaders.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t1296.0
text: We'll put that link in the show notes and we hope to see you there.

title: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni
id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t1308.0

id: Keeping Humans in the (Feedback) Loop - Orangetheory Fitness' Ameen Kazerouni-t1314.0
text: Your streams and downloads make a big difference.
